medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain due to perforated appendicitis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced 24 hours of initially per-umbilical pain, which then transitioned to constant and sharp pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Symptoms began yesterday afternoon after eating, initially described as a dull ache, which escalated by the morning to constant and sharp pain. The pain worsens with coughing or driving over bumps. Associated symptoms include chills but no fever, nausea without vomiting, and positive anorexia.
